# restorableState

**Type Property**

A change that invalidates the restorable state of the view.

## Declaration

```swift
static var restorableState: NSView.Invalidations.RestorableState { get }
```

## Discussion

Use this invalidation type to call [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSResponder/invalidateRestorableState()] so that a change in property value invalidates the viewʼs restorable state. This triggers the app to save any information the restoration system needs to restore the current state of the view.

## Types of Invalidations

- **constraints**: A change that invalidates a view’s constraints.
- **display**: A change that requires the system to redraw a view’s content.
- **intrinsicContentSize**: A change that invalidates a view’s intrinsic size.
- **layout**: A change that invalidates the layout of the containing view’s subviews.
